title: High-performance Brain-to-Text Communication via Handwriting
description: Neural recordings from a single participant using a Utah array BCI to decode attempted handwriting into text. Achieved record typing speeds for BCIs using RNN-based decoding.
full_description: This dataset contains neural activity recorded from a single participant with paralysis using two implanted 96-channel Utah arrays in the hand area of motor cortex. The participant attempted to handwrite 1,000 sentences (43,501 characters) across 10.7 hours. Neural signals were decoded into text using a recurrent neural network, achieving up to 90 characters per minute at 94.1% accuracy online, and over 99% accuracy offline with autocorrect. Includes real-time BCI outputs.
data_format: Custom binary format (handwritingBCIData.tar.gz), documentation in accompanying PDF
sampling_rate: Not specified (Utah array with typical rates of 30 kHz per channel before preprocessing)
